info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 3 at 6:27PM MDT until June 3 at 8:15PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque NM
info.description:
At 627 PM MDT, trained weather spotters reported flash flooding in Kirtland. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain.
SOURCE...Trained spotters reported that flooding has been observed in the Kirtland area.
IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas.
Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Farmington, Bloomfield, Aztec, Shiprock, Kirtland, Nenahnezad, Fruitland, Ojo Amarillo, Upper Fruitland and NAPI Headquarters.
This includes the following highways... Highway 550 between Mile Markers 157 and 162. Highway 64 between Mile Markers 13 and 63.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Arroyos, streams, and normally dry rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes. Water in arroyos can travel many miles and take hours to reach your location from upstream rain areas.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTHWESTERN SAN JUAN COUNTY
